p: In the first experiment, EO and NSEO Z. riedelianum had a significant effect on the mortality of nymphs (56.53–85.20% and 30.23–66.18%, respectively) ( Figure 3). Nymphal mortality gradually increased with essential oil concentrations, regardless of form. A log-logistic model provided the best fit for both EO and NSEO ( R 2 = 89.80%) ( Figure 3). When the two curves were compared using Wilcoxon’s test, the essential oils were significantly different ( p < 0.001).
